description: Letters explaining UK laws about nationality. Sometimes called information notes.

attachments.title: Hong Kong: confirmation of British nationality
All countries and territories: dual nationality
All countries and territories: confirmation of British nationality

details.body:
The Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office provides standard letters to explain UK laws about British nationality to local authorities when you’re abroad. This includes confirmation of British nationality and dual nationality.

If you’re asked to provide proof of a UK law when you’re abroad, download the relevant letter.

Dual nationality permitted

If you’re asked to provide proof of UK law about dual nationality, download the relevant letter.

If your country or territory is not listed, use the ‘All countries and territories’ letter.

You can get a signed and stamped version of a letter, which costs £50.

All countries and territories: dual nationality

PDF, 302 KB, 1 page

Azerbaijan: dual nationality

PDF, 15.4 KB, 1 page

This file may not be suitable for users of assistive technology.

Request an accessible format.
If you use assistive technology (such as a screen reader) and need a version of this document in a more accessible format, please email fcdo.correspondence@fcdo.gov.uk. Please tell us what format you need. It will help us if you say what assistive technology you use.

Confirmation of British nationality unavailable

British embassies, high commissions and consulates cannot confirm British nationality. If you’re asked to provide proof of this, download the relevant letter.

If your country or territory is not listed, use the ‘All countries and territories’ letter.

You can get a signed and stamped version of a letter, which costs £50.

Renouncing British citizenship

If you’re asked to provide proof of UK law about renouncing British citizenship, download the relevant letter. You can get a signed and stamped version of a letter, which costs £50.

No objection to change of nationality unavailable

The British Embassy cannot issue a no objection letter to a British person who wants to change the nationality on their Saudi residence permit (Iqama). If you’re asked to provide proof, download this letter. You can get a signed and stamped version of a letter, which costs £50.

Saudi Arabia: change of nationality

change_history.note: All countries and territories letter removed.
